intro: Solanum espinarense, commonly known as the Espinareño nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its spiny stems and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum espinarense is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It is part of the nightshade family, which includes both edible and toxic species.
